ratings.comment: Jacqueline is a bit strict, and initially quite cold in her temperament during class (although she became calmer over time). But she was always kind to me. The class is a bit boring and monotonic, but helpful. The 3 group projects are very enjoyable. Be prepared to participate in class and to be called on. And of course, attend class.

By far the worst teacher I've ever had the first 9 weeks of the semester; attitude was horrible and made students feel uncomfortable in class. She was reported to the French Chair any they had a "talk" with her. Luckily the rest of the year went much better and she would actually smile and talk to students appropriately. NO EXCUSES for attendance
She's tough, but she'll teach you what you need to know and help you get there

This was my first and only French class at UW-Madison. I don't know what the rest of the French department is like, but this wasn't a very good introduction. I felt that our professor was very worksheet-heavy and assigned far too many tedious grammar assignments. I know that a language class is going to have grammar, but 7 a day is excessive.

She is a really nice teacher. When I have any problems about assignments and projects, I email her, and she responds really fast ( and effectively!). She has lots interactions with us during lectures and that improves our (French) oral and listening a lot. I know she might be a little strict, but it helps us to learn much more than if she doesn't:)

Save yourself the hassle and switch to a new TA. She has been reported to the Dean of Students many times but the French department kept her on. She increases the difficulty on every single assignment, cold call you and if you dont know the answer, she will harass you and get the class to laugh at you.
